TopicTitle: Crashing with a whole lot of mods, same mods as last night however. First time publishing a bug report, please tell me if I need to change anything. Thanks!

Articles.Content:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/16RbDq_SXW659QFEGx_0ERYj1XUlmBrQW/view?usp=sharing Google Drive link.
Mods: There are literally 173 of them, so I'll list CKAN's autolist at the very end of the area to not clutter and provide you without context.
Reproduction: Open the game.

I can't exactly narrow it down to what mods, but last night I had the same mods and did NOT fail to launch the game.

I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH: THE OUTDATED MODS WORKED PREVIOUSLY AND ARE UNLIKELY TO BE THE CAUSE. SOME OF THESE MODS JUST DO NOT HAVE AN UPDATE OR ARE DOWNGRADED. NO KSP UPDATE SHOULD HAVE CHANGED THIS, AS THERE HAVEN'T BEEN ANY.

When was the last time  CKAN updated something in your rig?

Fairly recently, why?

I updated contract configurator to try to fix a separate mission builder bug, but it worked for the first few launches of the game.

It's a mod problem, confirmed. Clean install fixed on a different drive. Now it's time to pinpoint which mod (or mod combo) it was.

Edited April 10, 2023 by goober_one
fixing grammar

Well, the debug copy on vanilla worked so I brought back all the mods... and it worked for a single game launch. Then it froze on loading a save and promptly crashed. I'm going to check if it's something wrong with my newer mods. Really thought I had it!

I might have it here, if it doesn't then I'm stumped.

Edited April 12, 2023 by goober_one
Clarification
I DID IT! It had left over real solar system textures, for some reason. It should have removed it automatically!
